t: Proverbs 2
Wisdom’s Worth
My*pn son, if you accept my words and*ln store up my commands within you,
listening*ln closely to wisdom and*ln directing your heart to understanding;
furthermore,*ln if you call out to insight and*ln lift your voice to understanding,
if*ln you seek it like silver and*ln search for it like hidden treasure,
then*ln you will understand the fear of the Lord*s and*ln discover the knowledge of God.
For*ln the Lord*s gives wisdom; from*ln his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
He*ln stores up success for the upright; He*ln is a shield for those who live with integrity
so*ln that he may guard the paths of justice and*ln protect the way of his faithful followers.
Then*ln you will understand righteousness, justice, and*ln integrity - every good path.
For*ln wisdom will enter your heart, and*ln knowledge will delight you.
Discretion*ln will watch over you, and*ln understanding will guard you.
It*ln will rescue you from the way of evil — from*ln anyone who says perverse things,
from*ln those who abandon the right paths to*ln walk in ways of darkness,
from*ln those who enjoy doing evil and*ln celebrate perversion,
whose*ln paths are crooked, and*ln whose ways are devious.
It*ln will rescue you from a forbidden woman, from*ln a wayward woman with her flattering talk,
who*ln abandons the companion of her youth and*ln forgets the covenant of her God;
for*ln her house sinks down to death and*ln her ways to the land of the departed spirits.
None*ln return who go to her; none*ln reach the paths of life.
So*ln follow the way of the good, and*ln keep to the paths of the righteous.
For*ln the upright will inhabit the land, and*ln those of integrity will remain in it;
but*ln the wicked will be cut off from the land, and*ln the treacherous ripped out of it.
